inlineContent.text: This method generates a PDF417 barcode as an image. PDF417 is a high-density stacked linear barcode format defined in the ISO 15438 standard. Use this filter to generate alphanumeric or numeric-only barcodes. Commonly used on identification cards or inventory management because of the large amount of data the barcode can hold.
The PDF417 barcode generator filter uses the following properties:
object representing the data to be encoded as a barcode.
representing the minimum width of the barcode’s data area, in pixels as an
representing the maximum width of the barcode’s data area, in pixels, as an
representing the maximum height of the barcode’s data area, in pixels, as an
representing the minimum height of the barcode’s data area, in pixels, as an
representing the number of columns in the data area as an
representing the number of rows in the data area as an
representing the desired aspect ratio as an
An option that determines which method the generator uses to compress data as an
. See the note below for the possible values.
that determines the omission of redundant elements to make the generated barcode more compact as an

between 0 and 8 that determines the amount of redundancy to include in the barcode’s data to prevent errors when the barcode is read. If left unspecified, the generator chooses a correction level based on the size of the message data.
that determines the inclusion of information about the compaction mode in the barcode as an
. If a PDF417 barcode doesn’t contain compaction mode information, the reader assumes text-based compaction.
property takes one of the following numeric values:
The generator automatically chooses a compression method. This option is the default.
Valid only when the message is an ASCII-encoded string of digits, achieving optimal compression for that type of data.
Valid only when the message is all ASCII-encoded alphanumeric and punctuation characters, achieving optimal compression for that type of data.
Valid for any data, but least compact.
Select either 1 or the appropriate valid value for your data that gives the most compact output.
The following code creates a filter that generates a PDF417 barcode:

abstract.text: Generates a quick response (QR) code image.
Generates a barcode as an image from the descriptor.
Generates a pattern made from an array of line segments.
Generates a line of stripes as an image
Generates an image resembling the sun.
Creates an image containing the outline of a rounded rectangle.
